spray.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area
spray.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The fruit is sprayed every four weeks.
Someone had sprayed blue paint over his car.
Vandals had sprayed graffiti on the walls.
spray.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if liquids or small bits spray somewhere, they are quickly scattered through the air
spray.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: liquid which is forced out of a special container in a stream of very small drops
spray.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a container which forces liquid out in a stream of small drops
spray.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Mary took a perfume spray from her handbag.
spray.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
spray.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: My face was stinging from the salt spray.
spray.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: liquid that comes quickly from somewhere in very small drops
spray.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: A spray of blood came from his mouth.
spray.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: a small branch or stem with leaves or flowers on it, used for decoration
spray.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: an attractive arrangement of flowers or leaves
spray.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: a spray of violets and primroses
